name: 許益瑞
objective:
本課程介紹金屬材料物理與化學性質、包括 (1) 原子結構 (2) 鍵結理論 (3)分子軌域 (4) 貴重金屬之光譜、反應與機構，以及 (5) 有機金屬材料之製備與催化。

Modern metal related materials are designed and synthesized based on the concepts of solid state chemistry and coordination chemistry. This implies most of them are related to metal complexes. The first part of this course will include the modern theory on studying these materials, such as the quantum theory of atomic structure, structural symmetry, molecular orbitals theory, chemical bonding, crystal field theory, spectra and so on. The others will be related to the synthetic methods on these metal complexes and application on catalysis.
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction 
Week 2 Atomic structure
Week 3 Simple Bonding Theory
Week 4 Symmetry and Group Theory (I)
Week 5 Symmetry and Group Theory (II)
Week 6 Molecular Orbitals (I)
Week 7 Molecular Orbitals (II)
Week 8 The Crystalline Solid State
Week 9 Midterm
Week 10 Coordination Chemistry I : Structures and Isomers
Week 11 Coordination Chemistry I : Structures and Isomers
Week 12 Coordination Chemistry II : Bonding
Week 13 Coordination Chemistry II : Bonding
Week 14 Coordination Chemistry III : Electronic spectra
Week 15 Coordination Chemistry III : Electronic spectra
Week 16 Coordination Chemistry IV : Reactions and Mechanisms
Week 17 Coordination Chemistry IV : Reactions and Mechanisms
Week 18 Final Exam.
materials:
References:
1.	Gary . Miessler and Donald A. Tarr Inorganic Chemistry, 4th ed.
2.	A. R. West Basic Solid State Chemistry, 1991. 
3.	R. S. Drago Physical Methods for chemists 2nd ed. 1992.
